title: Reform UK claims it has overtaken Labour as Britain’s largest party
description: Nigel Farage’s party says it has more than 268,000 members amid reports Labour membership has fallen below 250,000
content:
Reform UK says it is now the largest political party in Britain and has overtaken Labour, which has reportedly seen its membership fall below 250,000.
Nigel Farage’s party says it has more than 268,000 members on the live tracker displayed on its web... [2060 chars]

title: Amazon pulls AI recap from Fallout TV show after it made several mistakes
description: The errors included getting dialogue wrong and incorrectly claiming a scene was set 100 years earlier than it was.
content:
Amazon has pulled a video recap made with artificial intelligence (AI) from its hit TV show Fallout after users said it got several facts wrong about the series.
The firm said in November it was testing the "first-of-its-kind" tool in the US to help ... [2163 chars]

title: Primal Scream says video with alleged antisemitic imagery shown at gig was meant to provoke debate
description: The rock band have been reported to police for showing a film at a gig which appeared to include imagery of the Star of David entwined with a swastika.
content:
Primal Scream have said a video containing alleged antisemitic imagery was a "piece of art" and was intended to "provoke debate, not hate".
Warning: This article contains alleged antisemitic imagery.
The Scottish rock band have been reported to the M... [3134 chars]

title: ‘Beyond belief’ that resident doctors could strike amid flu crisis, says Starmer
description: Exclusive: PM’s outspoken attack on stoppages planned for 17-22 December risks inflaming tensions with medics
content:
Keir Starmer has said it is “frankly beyond belief” that resident doctors would strike during the NHS’s worst moment since the pandemic, in remarks that risk inflaming tensions with medical staff.
Writing for the Guardian, the prime minister made an ... [6790 chars]

title: The huge cost of following you team at the World Cup
description: Supporters tell BBC Sport of their frustration at the astronomical cost of following the 2026 World Cup.
content:
Supporters are continuing to speak of their frustration at the astronomical cost of following the 2026 World Cup.
The Football Supporters' Association has called ticket prices a "laughable insult" to fans.
